content.description: Similar to Bunny Hop with a few more hold options for climbers of different heights.
content.protection: 5 bolts to FISH MussyHooks (new anchors installed 11/29/2020). Note: local ethic suggests that you toprope off your own gear in order to avoid excessive wear on the anchors, but it's okay to lower off the anchors when cleaning the route in order to prevent accidents related to untying and going off belay when rappelling.

content.description: Climb your way up positive edges on low angle slab. Good movement,Â nice mantle about halfway up
content.protection: 8 bolts to Climbtech hooks, which were replaced February 2020. Note: local ethic suggests that you toprope off your own gear in order to avoid excessive wear on the anchors, but it's okay to lower off the anchors when cleaning the route in order to prevent accidents related to untying and going off belay when rappelling. A 50m rope is just enough to cover this route.

content.description: fairly straightforward start through the first couple clips, then up and over the bulge (I assume this is the bunny hop) to a thinner face section.
content.protection: 5 bolts to mussyhook anchors (installed 11/29/2020). Note: local ethic suggests that you toprope off your own gear in order to avoid excessive wear on the anchors, but it's okay to lower off the anchors when cleaning the route in order to prevent accidents related to untying and going off belay when rappelling.
content.location: this is the route on the far left of the 4 in this area

content.description: heads up left around small corner through thin face and over a bulge
content.protection: 6 bolts to Climbtech hook anchors (installed Feb 2020). Note: local ethic suggests that you toprope off your own gear in order to avoid excessive wear on the anchors, but it's okay to lower off the anchors when cleaning the route in order to prevent accidents related to untying and going off belay when rappelling.
